--- title: "Basic examples of code" page-layout: article jupyter: julia-1.11 --- ::: {#d72d13c9 .cell execution_count=3} ``` {.julia .cell-code} x = 1 2x ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=3} ``` 2 ``` ::: ::: ::: {#3e0af8f6 .cell execution_count=4} ``` {.julia .cell-code} x = sqrt(2) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=4} ``` 1.4142135623730951 ``` ::: ::: ::: {#f05305e7 .cell execution_count=5} ``` {.julia .cell-code} # unicode is great x = âˆš(2) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=5} ``` 1.4142135623730951 ``` ::: ::: ::: {#2fadbe44 .cell execution_count=6} ``` {.julia .cell-code} ðŸ˜„ = sqrt(2) 2ðŸ˜„ ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=6} ``` 2.8284271247461903 ``` ::: ::: Some functions. ::: {#c7436d91 .cell execution_count=7} ``` {.julia .cell-code} # this is a function function f(x) return 2x+1 end ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=7} ``` f (generic function with 1 method) ``` ::: ::: ::: {#76d9de67 .cell execution_count=8} ``` {.julia .cell-code} # this also f(x) = 2x+1 ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=8} ``` f (generic function with 1 method) ``` ::: ::: ::: {#bfa5b096 .cell execution_count=9} ``` {.julia .cell-code} # this also: but f is not available anymore g = x -> 2x^2 ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=9} ``` #20 (generic function with 1 method) ``` ::: ::: ::: {#bce89031 .cell execution_count=10} ``` {.julia .cell-code} # be careful of the priorities g(1) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=10} ``` 2 ``` ::: ::: ::: {#feb3d9c7 .cell execution_count=11} ``` {.julia .cell-code} Hello(name) = "Hello " * name * "!" Hello("Alban") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=11} ``` "Hello Alban!" ``` ::: ::: ::: {#e9771075 .cell execution_count=12} ``` {.julia .cell-code} x = [1 3 12] println("x[2] = ", x[2]) x[2] = 5 println("x[2] = ", x[2]) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` x[2] = 3 x[2] = 5 ``` ::: ::: The following function has side effects that can be dangerous. ::: {#9dc1d18e .cell execution_count=13} ``` {.julia .cell-code} function f(x, y) x[1] = 42 # mutates x y = 7 + sum(x) # new binding for y, no mutation return y end a = [4, 5, 6] b = 3 println("f($a, $b) = ", f(a, b)) println("a = ", a, " # a[1] is changed to 42 by f") println("b = ", b, " # not changed") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` f([4, 5, 6], 3) = 60 a = [42, 5, 6] # a[1] is changed to 42 by f b = 3 # not changed ``` ::: ::: When a function has [side effects](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Side_effect_(computer_science)), please use the `!` convention. See [Argument Passing Behavior](https://docs.julialang.org/en/v1/manual/functions/#man-argument-passing). ::: {#450c152f .cell execution_count=14} ``` {.julia .cell-code} function put_at_second_place!(x, value) x[2] = value return nothing end x = [1 3 12] println("x[2] = ", x[2]) put_at_second_place!(x, 5) println("x[2] = ", x[2]) put_at_second_place!(x[1:3], 15) # be careful if you give a slice println("x[2] = ", x[2]) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` x[2] = 3 x[2] = 5 x[2] = 5 ``` ::: ::: A function may have several methods. ::: {#d7fa62c6 .cell execution_count=15} ``` {.julia .cell-code} Î£(x::Float64, y::Float64) = 2x + y ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=15} ``` Î£ (generic function with 1 method) ``` ::: ::: ::: {#50cfd549 .cell execution_count=16} ``` {.julia .cell-code} Î£(2.0, 3.0) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=16} ``` 7.0 ``` ::: ::: ::: {#017ecc6c .cell execution_count=17} ``` {.julia .cell-code} Î£(2, 3.0) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-error} ::: {.ansi-escaped-output} ```{=html}

``` ::: ::: ::: ::: {#7aa00a71 .cell execution_count=18} ``` {.julia .cell-code} h(x::Number, y::Number ) = 2x - y h(x::Int, y::Int ) = 2x * y h(x::Float64, y::Float64) = 2x + y ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=18} ``` h (generic function with 3 methods) ``` ::: ::: ::: {#f4fe3f2f .cell execution_count=19} ``` {.julia .cell-code} println("h(2, 3.0) = ", h(2, 3.0)) println("h(2, 3 ) = ", h(2, 3)) println("h(2.0, 3.0) = ", h(2.0, 3.0)) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` h(2, 3.0) = 1.0 h(2, 3 ) = 12 h(2.0, 3.0) = 7.0 ``` ::: :::
